title: Sulli dead: Celebrities pay tribute following suspected suicide
text:
Sulli is suspected to have taken her own life (Picture: EPA/YONHAP)

The entertainment industry has continued to pay tribute to singer Sulli, after the K-pop star died this week aged 25.

The former f(x) member – real name Choi Jin-ri – passed away on Monday in an apparent suicide, with her manager discovering her at her home in Seongnam in South Korea’s Gyeonggi Province.

Sulli was found dead at 3.20pm after her manager went to her house when he couldn’t contact her. Parademics arrived at 3.39pm, where they found Sulli dead on arrival.

A police official told Yonhap: ‘Choi seemed to have lived alone in the house.

‘It seems that she took her own life but we are also looking into other possibilities.’

Sulli was a member of f(x) (Picture: Han Myung-Gu/WireImage)

In the wake of the devastating news, a number of artists from SM Entertainment and other agencies have cancelled their events, as they pay tribute online.

As the emotional messages continued to pour in, singer Dean, who had collaborated with Sulli on the single dayfly, wrote on his Instagram Stories: ‘Your voice will raise a question that will weigh heavily upon many people for a long time. I sincerely thank you and am sorry. I will remember you.’

Jobin, of duo NORAZO, shared an emotional post on Instagram, along with the image of a flower.

‘I pray that you will not be cold on your way there. The world loved you!’ he wrote.

‘I hope you will momentarily forget the hearts that hurt you because they have a hard time expressing love and that you will rest in peace.

‘I felt great joy and pride just to be able to work in the same generation as you. Later on, let’s all meet on the stage of heaven and sing songs of joy without sadness.’

He added: ‘Thank you. Goodbye.’

Presenter and singer Solbi added a shot of clouds and sunrays, with the caption translated to read: ‘The memories of passing by you backstage when you were young and the sides of Sulli that I saw through broadcasts and media were so beautiful and confident.

‘Many people loved those carefree sides of you. I will remember your flower-like beauty just as it was. I hope you can rest comfortably now…Rest in peace.’

Singer Nam Tae Hyun posted a photo of Sulli with the caption, translated to English: ‘I will live with gratitude for your boldness and what you have achieved. I hope you will rest in peace.’

Adding to the tributes, singer-songwriter Jang Kiha hoped Sulli was ‘at peace,’ with the hashtag ‘RIP’, while fellow singer Shinji wrote: ‘Saying my farewell now as I was emotional the entire day yesterday…I sincerely hope you will be comfortable and happy in that place and that you will smile a lot with your beautiful and bright smile.’

Jung Ryeo Won’s post featured an image with the text: ‘You are beautiful. You are worthy. You are enough,’ and her caption read: ‘You are missed.’

Actor Hong Suk Chun uploaded a shot of himself with Sulli, the pair embracing and smiling for the camera.

‘To think this would be my last photo with you… I said we should stick through it together, but I’ve become a bad [friend] who let you go without even saying goodbye. I’m sorry, I’m so sorry,’ he wrote.

‘I hope you are no longer hurting in that place, and I hope you can spend your time doing whatever you want. I’ll remember the beautiful you exactly as you were. It’s a sad night.’

SM Entertainment confirmed Sulli’s tragic passing in a statement issued following the news of her death.

The agency said: ‘We apologise for conveying such sad and unfortunate news. Sulli has left our side.

‘We cannot believe the situation now and we are just filled with grief.

‘For her family who is grieving after the sudden news of her passing, we earnestly request that you refrain from writing speculative articles or spreading rumours. We express our deep condolences.’
